result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian W. Heidger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

Not eligible for challenge incarceration.
Eligible for substance abuse.
Maintain absolute sobriety for the duration of supervision.
No controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician.
Comply with psychological treatment as recommended by providers.
Take medications as prescribed by prescribers.
Comply with any other assessments, treatments and programming deemed appropriate by the Compas assessment and DOC.
Sign releases of information forms for offender's assessments, medications/pharmacies and/or treatment.
Provide agent will list of all medications for which he is prescribed.
Pay all court ordered financial obligations in full 90 days prior to discharge.
Provide DNA sample if not done so.

supervisions.notes: Revocation is retroactive to the date of the administrative suspension from the Dept. of Transportation

records.addlTxt: Transcript of Sentencing Hearing held on July 29, 2016
and Exhibit #D1 Letter from the Defendant
Count 1
Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Brian W. Heidger in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson. Defendant Brian W. Heidger in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

11:01 AM Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

Court has the original PSI.
State received a copy.
Defense received a copy.

There are no corrections or additions to the PSI.
There is no reason why Defendant should not be sentenced today.

Court has read the PSI this morning and went over the file.

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court prior to sentencing, recommends prison.

Atty Halverson addresses the Court prior to sentencing, recommends jail and probation. Atty Halverson reads a letter written by Defendant
Exhibit #1 is marked on behalf of Defendant.

Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court states the facts of the case, for the record. Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1:
Determinate Prison Sentence for 4 years
Initial Confinement for 2 years
Extended Supervision for 2 years
96 days credit already served
Not eligible for challenge incarceration
Eligible for substance abuse
Conditions:
Maintain absolute sobriety for the duration of supervision
No controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician
Comply with psychological treatment as recommended by providers
Take medications as prescribed by prescribers
Comply with any other assessments, treatments and programming deemed appropriate by the Compas assessment and DOC
Sign releases of information forms for offender's assessments, medications/pharmacies and/or treatment
Provide agent will list of all medications for which he is prescribed
Pay all court ordered financial obligations in full 90 days prior to discharge
Provide DNA sample if not done so
Pay fine of $600 plus costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay blood draw of $26.45
All to be paid out of prison account in the amount of 25%
Drivers License Revoked 24 Months, retroactive to the first day of any administrative suspension
IID 24 Months

Appeal rights are addressed.
Defendant is remanded to the custody of the Sheriff
Sentencing hearing on July 29, 2016 at 11:00 am.
distributed to ADA Knaapen/SPD Halverson 6-15-16(kp)
Sentencing hearing on June 24, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Brian W. Heidger in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson. Defendant Brian W. Heidger in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

3:01 PM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Court has been handed an amended information.

Court has also been handed Plea questionnaire/Agreement.

Atty Halverson received a copy of the amended information.

Count 1 is being amended to conform with evidence in this case - operating with restricted controlled substance instead of OWI. Penalties remain the same.

There is a plea agreement.
Defendant will plead to amended Count 1. Count 2 and 3 would be dismissed and read in.
State recommends 4 yrs prison, 2 yrs initial and 2 yrs extended. Parties anticipate the Court to order a PSI. Defense is free to argue.

Court would like a PSI before sentencing.

Atty Halverson concurs with plea agreement.

Court questions Defendant. 
Atty Halverson addresses the Court regarding anxiety. Defendant understands the charge and what his pleading to today and understands the process.
Court continues questioning Defendant.

Defendant enters a plea of: Amended Count 1: NO CONTEST

3:09 PM Atty Halverson takes a moment to confer with her client.

3:10 PM Court continues with hearing.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Halverson for Defendant. Atty Halverson has had extended conversations with her client.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Court informs Defendant regarding possessing firearms in the future and civil rights regarding voting.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Amended - Found Guilty
Count 2: Dismissed and Read In
Count 3: Dismissed and Read In


BY THE COURT:
Court will order a PSI.

State requests bond be revoked.

BY THE COURT:
Bond is revoked.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 24, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary Hearing set for 02/08/16 - attempted, not known
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 21, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference at 03-07-2016 10:00 am
filed by the State

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference at 02-15-2016 09:00 am

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Defendant Brian W. Heidger in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson. Defendant Brian W. Heidger in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
3:32 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Atty Halverson make statements, raises competency at this time. 
Court questions Atty Halverson further. 

Court questions defendant further regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 09:00 am.
filed by Atty Acalia Halverson

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing at 02-08-2016 03:00 pm

Attorney  Acalia N Halverson in court for Defendant Brian W. Heidger. Prosecuting Atty Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Brian W. Heidger appeared by video.
Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Defendant on PO hold.
Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Atty Acalia Halverson appointed

Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not operate a vehicle unless absolutely sober.
Do not operate a vehicle without a valid driver's license.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming controlled substances.
Participate in the Portage County Pre-Trial Supervision Program and comply with the requirements for reporting, assessment, and programming.

DA Louis Molepske appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

DA Molepske states facts for anticipated charges of OWI/Controlled substance - 5th offense, Possession of THC.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

State requests a $2,000 cash bond with conditions as stated.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  1/19/16  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 2

Defendant makes statements to the Court re: bond.
